title: Israel strikes near Syria’s Sweida, first raid after Syrian troops' withdrawal
content: Israeli strikes targeted areas near Sweida, a Druze-majority city, following the withdrawal of Syrian government forces after clashes with local fighters. These strikes occurred amidst escalating violence, with reports of civilian casualties and humanitarian concerns. Israel asserts its actions aim to protect the Druze minority and prevent hostile forces from establishing a presence near the Golan Heights.

title: Trump diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency: White House confirms
content: Amid speculations about President Trump's bruised hand, the White House disclosed a diagnosis of a chronic, benign vein condition discovered during an examination for swollen legs. Spokesperson Karoline Leavitt attributed hand bruising to frequent handshaking and aspirin use, dismissing concerns about more serious conditions like deep vein thrombosis or arterial disease.

title: Sorry for wife, but glad: Astronomer CEO’s wife’s post viral after he's caught cheating
content: A Coldplay concert's 'Kiss Cam' captured Astronomer CEO Andy Byron in an embrace with Kristin Cabot, the company's Chief People Officer, sparking a viral sensation and intense scrutiny. The incident has drawn Byron's wife, Megan Kerrigan Byron, into the public eye, with her online profiles reflecting potential marital discord.

title: Now, Beijing supports revival of Russia-India-China troika
content: China has expressed its support for Russia's proposal to revive the Russia-India-China (RIC) troika, a consultative forum for discussing global and regional issues. Moscow is actively negotiating with Beijing and New Delhi for the resumption of RIC. The initiative follows S Jaishankar's visit to China for the SCO foreign ministers meeting, where he met with his Chinese and Russian counterparts.

title: Russia oil squeeze: Trump’s 100% tariff threat - should India panic?
content: Amidst Trump's threat of secondary tariffs on countries trading with Russia, will India's crude oil supply face uncertainty? Russia has become India's top oil supplier due to discounted rates, potential tariffs could disrupt this. However, India's diversified procurement, strategic reserves, and growing oil imports from other markets may mitigate the impact, suggesting resilience against supply shocks.

title: What is 'Kiss Cam' that caught Astronomer CEO's affair with HR head Cabot
content: At a Coldplay concert, a 'Kiss Cam' captured Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and Chief People Officer Kristin Cabot's awkward reaction, sparking affair rumors after they seemingly tried to hide from the camera. Lead singer Chris Martin playfully commented on their behavior, fueling speculation. 'Kiss Cams' are a common concert feature, engaging audiences by prompting couples to kiss on screen.

title: India tests new weapons system for China border
content: The Indian Army will soon induct two Akash Prime surface-to-air missile regiments, designed for high-altitude air defense along the Chinese border. Successful tests in Ladakh demonstrated the system's ability to destroy aerial targets at 15,000 feet. This induction will significantly boost India's air defense capabilities, especially in high-altitude operational environments.

title: Rain halts Amarnath yatra: Army rescues 500 stranded pilgrims
content: The Amarnath Yatra has been temporarily suspended from Jammu, Pahalgam, and Baltal base camps due to rain-damaged tracks. Repair work is underway, with resumption planned for July 18, weather permitting. This decision follows a pilgrim's death and injuries to three others due to landslides, prompting army rescue efforts for stranded pilgrims. So far, 2.5 lakh pilgrims have visited the shrine.

title: Intel layoffs announced in July cross 5,000, numbers increase by 4 times in ...
content: Global semiconductor giant Intel is implementing a significant restructuring plan, resulting in over 5,000 layoffs across US locations including California, Oregon, Arizona and Texas. The job cuts, impacting engineers, senior leaders, and back-office staff, aim to streamline operations and address financial losses. This follows 15,000 job cuts earlier in 2024, bringing the total to over 20,000.

title: Theft, assault can lead to visa being revoked, warns US embassy
content: The US Embassy in India has cautioned Indian travelers about potential visa revocations for crimes like theft and assault, following a viral video of an Indian woman attempting to shoplift $1,300 worth of goods in the US. The Ministry of External Affairs emphasized the importance of abiding by foreign laws to maintain a positive image abroad.

title: NC slams BJP over Ladakh LG appointment, calls it betrayal of promise
content: National Conference has criticised the central government's decision. The decision involves appointing Bharatiya Janata Party leader Kavinder Gupta as Ladakh's Lieutenant Governor. NC spokesperson Tanvir Sadiq said this move contradicts BJP's claims made during the abrogation of Article 370. He added that the appointment exposes BJP's real motives. BJP welcomed the appointment and felicitated Gupta in Jammu.

title: Voting age to be lowered to 16 across UK: Government
content: The UK government has confirmed lowering the voting age to 16 for all UK elections, aligning with Scotland and Wales, potentially adding 1.5 million young voters. Alongside this, British voters can now use UK-issued bank cards as voter ID, and stricter measures will be implemented to combat foreign donations and protect candidates from harassment.

title: Shaquille O’Neal threatens to punch Robert Griffin III over Angel Reese
content: NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal has issued a stern warning to former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III over his negative comments and a racist social media post targeting WNBA player Angel Reese. O'Neal, angered by Griffin's actions, particularly the reposting of a derogatory image, threatened physical violence if Griffin continues his behavior.

title: Bryan Braman dies at 38; cancer battle ends life of ex-Eagles LB — legacy revealed
content: Bryan Braman, former Eagles linebacker, passed away at 38 after a battle with brain cancer. He was a Super Bowl LII champion. Braman is survived by his two daughters and mother. He fought the disease with surgeries and treatment. The NFL community supported him. Braman's legacy includes his grit and dedication to his family.

title: Luka Doncic might walk from the Los Angeles Lakers. Here's why
content: Luka Doncic's future with the Los Angeles Lakers is uncertain as he approaches a player option in 2025-26. Tension arises from the Lakers' apparent shift towards prioritizing Doncic over LeBron James, potentially alienating the Slovenian star. Concerns grow that the Lakers' treatment of James could impact Doncic's trust and willingness to commit long-term.

title: Chess | Niemann responds to claims he ‘hate-watched’ Carlsen’s loss: 'If you think ... '
content: Hans Niemann responded to accusations of gloating over Magnus Carlsen's unexpected elimination from the Las Vegas Freestyle Chess Grand Slam. Niemann alluded to the ongoing controversy stemming from Carlsen's 2022 cheating allegations. Carlsen's shocking exit, especially after his previous dominance, has reignited the rivalry between the two chess players, adding another layer of intrigue to the unpredictable tournament.

title: Bihar polls: Why Nitish Kumar's caste survey was a political masterstroke
content: Nitish Kumar's political resilience in Bihar stems from his ability to cultivate a broad support base beyond his Kurmi caste. By championing the Extremely Backward Classes (EBCs) and implementing targeted schemes, he has positioned himself as their leader.

title: TACO vs WACO: Trump’s $50b tariff windfall - but will it last for US?
content: Donald Trump's tariff policy boosts US revenue. Customs duties hit a record $64 billion in the second quarter of 2025. Most nations avoid retaliation, preferring negotiation. China and Canada initially resisted but later retreated. The US leverages its market dominance. Concerns rise about potential long-term economic costs. The world awaits the next tariff deadline. Escalation risks remain high.

title: Aditi Chauhan, first Indian woman to play professional football in Europe, retires at 32
content: Aditi Chauhan, India's pioneering female professional footballer in Europe, has retired at 32 after a 17-year career. The former national team goalkeeper, who represented India 57 times and won three SAFF Championships, aims to develop opportunities for future generations. Chauhan, who played for West Ham United and Gokulam Kerala FC, overcame ACL injuries and societal doubts to achieve consistent success.

title: Ranchi remembers the man who taught Dhoni 'iconic helicopter shot'
content: Ranchi commemorated Santosh Lal, known as Bunty, on his 12th death anniversary, the man who taught MS Dhoni the iconic helicopter shot. Bunty's innovative wrist technique, learned on local grounds, became Dhoni's signature move, despite Santosh's own notable domestic career. Fans remember Bunty's contribution, acknowledging that the shot might not have existed without him.

title: Golfer Simon Mariani unexpectedly dies at 28 after lightning strike
content: Tragedy struck New Jersey's Ballyowen Golf Club. Simon Mariani, 28, was fatally injured by a lightning strike during a sudden storm. The incident occurred on July 8, 2025. Mariani, a Franklin Lakes resident and MTS Health Partners associate, passed away on July 14, 2025. Remembered for his talent and character, Mariani's funeral is scheduled for July 18 in Franklin Lakes.

title: Khelo Bharat Conclave | ‘Put nation first...’ - Mandaviya's stern message to NSFs
content: Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya urged national sports federations to prioritize national interest over personal egos to elevate India as a global sporting powerhouse by 2047. Addressing the 'Khelo Bharat Conclave,' he emphasized good governance and collaborative planning, highlighting the upcoming National Sports Governance Bill.

title: IND vs ENG: Not Bumrah, Team India coach calls this speedster 'a lion'
content: Jasprit Bumrah's prowess has been a major talking point ahead of the India-England series, but assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate has highlighted Mohammed Siraj's significant contributions. Despite not always having the expected returns, Siraj's lion-hearted approach and ability to create opportunities make him a vital asset to the Indian bowling attack.

title: India slams Nato chief's warning on trade with Russia; flags 'double standards'
content: External affairs ministry has cautioned against double standards following Nato chief Rutte's warning of potential secondary sanctions for countries, including India, maintaining trade ties with Russia. Rutte urged India, China, and Brazil to reconsider their economic relations with Moscow or face sanctions if Russia doesn't engage in peace talks.

title: 'Old news': Russia rolls eyes at US sanctions threat over Ukraine war
content: Russia has downplayed the threat of new US sanctions, dismissing them as commonplace. This reaction follows President Trump's 50-day ultimatum for Russia to negotiate a peace agreement with Ukraine, coupled with a NATO-backed military aid plan for Kyiv. Trump warned of imposing tariffs on Russia’s trading partners if no deal is reached, as the conflict continues without resolution.

title: 'Morale of criminals sky-high': After meeting Nadda, Chirag slams ally Nitish
content: Chirag Paswan has strongly criticized Bihar's deteriorating law and order situation, citing the Paras Hospital shooting as evidence of criminals openly challenging the administration. He expressed deep concern over the rising crime rate, especially with upcoming elections, and urged the government to take immediate action.

title: Exclusive | 25 female footballers sharing an apartment, now in India’s top tier: Story of Garhwal FC
content: Garhwal FC, a Delhi-based women's football team, has defied expectations by qualifying for the Indian Women’s League (IWL) a year ahead of schedule. Overcoming limited resources and humble living conditions, the team achieved an undefeated season, winning all 24 matches. Coach Akshay Unni's focus extends beyond football, prioritizing the development of his players as individuals.

title: Viral: Astronomer CEO caught 'cheating' with his HR chief at Coldplay concert
content: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and his company's Chief People Officer Kristin Cabot were caught on camera at a Coldplay concert in Boston, sparking affair rumors. ​​"Oh look at these two," Chris Martin commented without knowing that they were not married to each other. The video has gone viral with social media users wondering what happened next to Byron who is married and has kids.

title: IND vs ENG: Jasprit Bumrah available for 4th Test? Check details
content: Team India's assistant coach, Ryan ten Doeschate, revealed that Jasprit Bumrah's availability for the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford will be decided in Manchester. The decision hinges on factors like weather conditions, the team's best chance of winning, and a holistic view of the last two games in the series, considering Bumrah's preferred shorter spells.

title: BJP-UBT reunion? Uddhav meets Fadnavis day after CM's 'invite' to rejoin Mahayuti
content: Amidst political shifts in Maharashtra, Devendra Fadnavis has extended an invitation to Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena UBT to rejoin the ruling coalition. This comes after Thackeray met with Chief Minister Shinde, sparking speculation about a potential reconciliation. Fadnavis emphasized the BJP's stability until 2029, suggesting an opportunity for Thackeray to reconsider alliances.

title: IND vs ENG: India’s playing XI in limbo! Arshdeep's injury throws selection into chaos
content: During a net session in Manchester, Arshdeep Singh suffered a cut on his bowling hand while attempting to stop a shot, raising concerns about his availability for the fourth Test. The medical team is evaluating the injury to determine if stitches are needed, which will significantly impact India's team composition and planning for the upcoming match at Old Trafford.

title: 'Respect sensitivity of the loss': AAIB slams foreign media coverage of AI crash probe
content: The Air India crash investigator has criticized international media outlets for their "selective and unverified" reporting on the recent Air India crash. This rebuke follows a report by the Wall Street Journal suggesting the pilot cut fuel flow to the engines.

title: 'We couldn't chance it': Why the Suns and Bradley Beal finally came to terms
content: Throughout the February trade deadline to the draft to free agency, one element of the Suns' roster-building failure has loomed for the Suns: How to end their marriage to the three-time All-Star.

title: Sources: Steelers make Watt highest-paid non-QB
content: T.J. Watt and the Steelers have agreed to a three-year extension that will make him the highest-paid non-quarterback in NFL history -- again.

title: Chiefs star Rice sentenced to 30 days of jail time
content: Chiefs star Rashee Rice was sentenced to 30 days of jail time and five years' probation for his role in a multicar crash last year.

title: Chargers WR Williams retires, ends 8-year career
content: Chargers wide receiver Mike Williams is retiring from the NFL after eight seasons, with a source saying the decision surprised the team.

title: Elko: Unsigned Bengals pick not returning to A&M
content: Texas A&M coach Mike Elko quashed speculation about Shemar Stewart potentially seeking a return to college amid the rookie's contract dispute with the Bengals.

title: Trump mulls EO on athletes' employment status
content: President Donald Trump is considering an executive order that would require federal authorities to clarify whether college athletes can be considered employees of their schools.

title: WR Addison pleads to lesser charge in DUI case
content: Vikings wide receiver Jordan Addison pleaded no contest Thursday to a lesser charge to resolve a 2024 DUI citation, his attorney said.

title: Report: Arbiter ruled for NFL in faking injury gripe
content: An arbiter in February ruled in favor of the NFL in a grievance that the NFL Players Association encouraged running backs to "exaggerate" injuries to increase leverage during contract disputes.

title: 💗 Klay, Megan Thee Stallion on the red carpet
content: The NBA star and Grammy Award-winning rapper made their red carpet debut at her inaugural Pete & Thomas Foundation Gala.

title: The top 10 cornerbacks ahead of 2025 NFL season: Who is ranked after Pat Surtain II?
content: Who are the best cornerbacks in the NFL? We asked execs, coaches and scouts from around the league to rank their top 10.

title: 14 players who could be picked No. 1 in the 2026 NFL draft
content: Which quarterback could go first overall? What about edge rusher T.J. Parker or another non-QB? Let's project the race.

title: The 10 MLB trends that ruled the first half -- and whether they'll continue
content: From chaos in the AL East to emerging young sluggers, we break down the season's biggest themes and what we should expect down the stretch run.

title: WNBA players, coaches voice frustration over how games are called
content: Players, coaches and fans say they want greater consistency regarding how games are refereed and the level of physicality allowed.

title: How Bo Jackson on a bicycle united Alabama after a record-breaking storm
content: The GOAT created a bike ride to help tornado-damaged Alabama. No one knew what it'd do -- or how it'd end.

title: Ranking the top 25 college football recruits regardless of class
content: Why let rising seniors get all the glory? We break down the best prospects in the country, including underclassmen.

title: Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams -- with 2025 draft picks included!
content: Who is rising and falling in every major league farm system after the MLB draft? Kiley McDaniel digs in.

title: 'Sad.' 'Embarrassing.' Why players were a no-show at the MLB draft
content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: Weah to Marseille, Reyna to anywhere but Dortmund? Best transfer fits for USMNT stars
content: The World Cup is just one year away, so what moves, if any, should these eight USMNT players make to ensure they'll be in top form next summer?

title: Sources: Man Utd increase Mbeumo bid to $94M
content: Manchester United have increased their bid for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Thiago to return to Flick's Barça staff
content: Barcelona expect to close a deal for Thiago Alcantara to return to the club as part of coach Hansi Flick's staff in the coming weeks, various sources have told ESPN.

title: USMNT's Pepi 'very close' to return from injury
content: PSV Eindhoven and USMNT striker Ricardo Pepi revealed he's "very close" to a return to the pitch after suffering a knee injury in January.

title: Modric to new club Milan: 'Average' not acceptable
content: New signing Luka Modric made clear he won't stand for the mediocrity that AC Milan displayed last season for an eighth-placed finish in Serie A.

title: Sources: Liverpool advancing in talks over Ekitike
content: Liverpool are progressing in talks to sign striker Hugo Ekitike from Eintracht Frankfurt, sources told ESPN.

title: Argentina to allow away fans after 12-year ban
content: Argentine football clubs can now welcome away supporters after a 12-year ban, the Argentine Football Association said on Thursday.

title: KC Current aim to host WC team in new facilities
content: The Kansas City Current broke ground on more real estate expansion, bringing their investment in soccer facilities to between $225 million and $250 million.

title: Bradley: What it's like boxing Pacquiao, and how he can beat Barrios
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts about fighting Manny Pacquiao and breaks down Saturday's fight.

title: From Chase to London, ranking the most reliable TD scorers among WRs
content: A deep dive into the most trustworthy TD scorers among wideouts based on target data, efficiency and more.

title: Ranking MLS' 2025 third kits: Who hits, misses on retro vibes?
content: Eleven teams in MLS have third kits in 2025, and ESPN ranks each throwback-inspired shirt from worst to first.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to move for Villa's Rogers
content: Chelsea have made Aston Villa winger Morgan Rogers their top priority this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Passan: Inside the first swing-off in MLB All-Star Game history
content: On a night full of firsts, none resonated as much as the finale -- and Kyle Schwarber's titanic performance.

title: Form SIT to probe tax scam in Madurai Corporation: High Court
content: The judges direct the Inspector-General of Police (South Zone) and the Madurai Commissioner of Police to constitute the team, headed by a senior IPS officer with proven integrity

title: U.P. DGP says 238 criminals have been killed and 9,467 shot in leg in 14,973 encounters since 2017
content: The force has ensured an “aggressive crackdown on crime” under the Chief Minister’s directions, the DGP added.

title: HC tells W.B. to file affidavit on resuming student union polls
content: Student union elections came to a halt across higher education institutions a little before the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020

title: Dharmasthala burials case: Former SC Judge demands SIT probe monitored by a sitting or retired HC/SC Judge
content: Police are allegedly coercing him to mark the places he has buried the bodies on a white paper. Also, the statement of the whistleblower is being leaked to private individuals: V. Gopala Gowda

title: A day after Gopalganj clashes, India reiterates call for Bangladesh election ‘with everybody in its fold’
content: The clashes in Gopalganj occurred after NCP leaders arrived outside the memorial of Sheikh Mujib, which is guarded by Awami League activists

title: The parameters of ‘success’ in Bihar’s poll roll revision
content: It remains to be seen whether the Election Commission of India is able to ensure a fair exercise of verification in Bihar

title: India warns against ‘double standards’ over Russian oil
content: The Ministry of External Affairs responds to U.S. Congress Bill mandating 500% duties on countries buying Russian oil; NATO chief threatens India, China, Brazil, top buyers of Russian products, but EU also buys Russian oil

title: Thalassemia patients call for standardised tests to reduce transfusion-transmitted infections
content: At present, Nucleic Acid Testing (NAT), a highly sensitive molecular technique used to screen blood donations for infectious diseases, is used in some hospitals

title: POSH Act application to be extended to TV serial sector soon: WCD Director
content: Attention will also be given to applicability of POSH Act in the gig sector, she says at seminar on strengthening institutional mechanisms combating violence against women and girls

title: Pet Owner Shoots At Man After Argument Over Dog In UP, Case Filed: Cops
content: A case has been filed against a pet owner after he shot a man on his leg over an argument over walking his dog without a leash at a village here, police said on Thursday.

title: Strike On Gaza's Only Church "A Mistake", Netanyahu Tells Trump
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told US President Donald Trump on Thursday that a strike on Gaza's only Catholic church had been "a mistake," the White House said.

title: 'Historical Trend': Bihar Top Cop On Remark Linking 'Idle' Farmers To Crime
content: Crime data in Bihar has apparently shown a curious trend -- that it spikes in summer and drops once the monsoon hits. The state police have a curious explanation for it.

title: 'Brutality Of Crime Can't Be Only Yardstick': Top Court On Death Penalty
content: The Supreme Court has commuted a man's death penalty in a minor's rape and murder case to life in prison without remission.

title: Rekha Gupta Meets Nirmala Sitharaman, Centre Approves Rs 600 Crore For Delhi
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Wednesday met Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and secured an assurance of Rs 600 crore under the Centre's Special Assistance to States for Capital Investment (SASCI) scheme.

title: Cyber Fraud Every 20 Minutes In Chhattisgarh, Over Rs 700 Crore Lost In 2 Years
content: As India's digital transformation accelerates, Chhattisgarh is emerging as one of its most alarming cautionary tales.

title: Concerns Mount As Strike On Gaza's Only Catholic Church Injures Many
content: A strike on Gaza's only Catholic church injured several people on Thursday, the territory's civil defence agency and the Latin Patriarchate of Jerusalem said, as Italy's prime minister slammed "unacceptable" Israeli attacks on civilians.

title: Taliban Government Denies Monitoring Citizens After UK Data Leak
content: The Taliban government said Thursday it had not arrested or monitored Afghans involved in a secret British resettlement plan after a data breach was revealed this week.

title: Ukraine Considering Offering Drones To US In Exchange Of Weapons: Zelensky
content: President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy are considering a deal that involves Washington buying battlefield-tested Ukrainian drones

title: To Curb Cow Slaughter, Maharashtra May Use Anti-Organised Crime Law
content: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home, Yogesh Kadam, in the state Assembly on Thursday announced that the government will launch a special campaign to ban cow slaughter in unauthorised slaughterhouses across the state.

title: "No Meeting Agreed": Sources On Push For Russia-India-China Grouping
content: Amid what is seen as a push from China and Russia to revive the Russia-India-China troika, sources have said that India has not agreed to any meeting in this format.

title: "Many Jails Waiting For Gandhis": Himanta Sarma's Swipe At Rahul Gandhi
content: Taking a dig at Rahul Gandhi, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said the Congress MP openly encouraged encroachers and "land jihadis" to take over government lands.

title: Man Detained For Killing Gangster In Patna Hospital, All Accused Identified: Cops
content: The first accused has been detained in Bihar's hospital murder in which five men armed with guns walked into the Paras Hospital in Patna and shot a man who was undergoing treatment.

title: "Trying To Iron Out Issues": India On Proposed Trade Deal With US
content: Negotiations between India and the US are underway to iron out pending issues for a trade deal, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said on Thursday.

title: Siddaramaiah Flags Faulty Kannada-English Translations On Facebook, Instagram
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has flagged "faulty" auto translation of content from Kannada to English on Meta's platforms like Facebook and Instagram, and termed it "dangerous".

title: India Successfully Tests Prithvi-II, Agni-I Ballistic Missile Off Odisha
content: India on Thursday successfully test-fired short-range ballistic missiles Prithvi-II and Agni-I, the defence ministry said.

title: "West Bengal Is Suffering Because Of Trinamool's Misrule": PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address a public rally at the industrial township of Durgapur in West Burdwan district on Friday.

title: "Witch-Hunting": Congress On Probe Agency's Action Against Robert Vadra
content: The Congress on Thursday termed as "witch-hunting" the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) charge sheet against Robert Vadra and said it is another attempt of the government to "intimidate and persecute", which will fail miserably.

title: Government Had Nothing To Do With RCB Celebration: Siddaramaiah's Adviser
content: The Karnataka government had nothing to do with the event at Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy stadium that led to the stampede following the IPL victory of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru, said AS Ponnanna, legal advisor to Siddaramaiah.

title: For 1st Time Since Covid, More Than Half Of Top US Companies Junk Work From Home
content: For the first time since the pandemic upended work life five years ago, more than half the companies in the Fortune 100 have their employees fully back in the office, according to a report from real estate firm Jones Lang LaSalle Inc.

title: Should we have been surprised? A look back at the season's first-half predictions
content: How good is our crystal ball? Before the season's second half gets underway, let's see how our first-half predictions panned out.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire.

title: Top Georgia high school hoopers since 2000 : Who earned the crown?
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of Georgia based on high school career achievements.

title: Where do Taylor and Serrano land after all-women card?
content: Lots of movement after a boxing card with 17 titles on the line. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Steve Caballero on how Tony Hawk's Pro-Skater pushed skateboarding to innovate
content: Steve Caballero has been skating since he was 12, and he's been thrilled to see the scene grow alongside Tony Hawk's Pro Skater.

title: I&B Secretary urges AI startups to shape solutions for bridging linguistic divides
content: Invites them to participate in Kalaa Setu, Bhasha Setu challenges on WaveX Startup Accelerator Platform

title: Bombay High Court upholds constitutional validity of UAPA, rejects sedition challenge
content: Anil Baburao Baile’s petition questioned the constitutional validity of UAPA and sedition law provisions; court found no merit in the arguments raised by the Elgaar Parishad case accused

title: Congress to organise protest at Parliament demanding Statehood for Jammu and Kashmir
content: The Jammu and Kashmir unit of the party said the message would next be taken via the ‘Chalo Delhi Chalo’ campaign on July 21

title: CBFC assures Bombay High Court of decision on certification for film on Yogi Adityanath in two working days
content: Scheduled for theatrical release on August 1, the film ‘Ajey: The Untold Story of a Yogi’ draws inspiration from the book ‘The Monk Who Became Chief Minister’ and is said to depict the life of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath

title: Plea in Supreme Court says Bhopal gas victims have been ‘misclassified’
content: The plea claims that survivors with lasting, severe injuries and illnesses have been wrongly classified under ‘temporary disablement’ and ‘minor injury’ and under-compensated for years

title: Commuters flag lack of transparency in auto, cab fares on aggregator apps
content: Commuters argue that aggregator apps charge significantly higher than the meter fare, often due to vague policies like ‘tips’, ‘congestion fee’, ‘platform fees’, ‘driver addition’ etc

title: Indian Navy’s eastern fleet ships reach Singapore to bolster naval ties in Southeast Asia
content: Indian Navy and Republic of Singapore Navy share operational relations spanning over three decades of cooperation

title: Andhra Pradesh to see fairly widespread rainfall till July 24
content: State records 38% deficit rainfall since arrival of monsoon, with the exception of six districts which received normal rainfall; four districts record a large shortfall

title: Drift in India’s foreign policy a matter of serious concern; time for course correction: Congress
content: Opposition party flags the matter of India abstaining on the UN Resolution on Gaza ceasefire, and Indo-U.S. trade deal as key concerns

title: Karnataka government decides to undo denotification
content: Despite the rule, denotification was taken up, which is illegal. Action will be initiated against officials who were responsible for the illegal act: H.K. Patil

title: Rahul Gandhi to inaugurate second death anniversary of Oommen Chandy
content: The visit is anticipated to significantly energise Congress party’s rank and file ahead of the local body elections later this year and the Assembly elections next year

title: CISF trains with Army to combat security threats
content: An official said CISF personnel deployed for Parliament security are being trained with the Army to combat terrorist strikes, drone attacks and internal sabotage

title: Amrabad now has 36 tigers
content: The monitoring for the previous year estimated the tiger population at 33; a total of 1,594 camera traps were in place in the reserve between December 20, 2024 and May 15, 2025

title: No permission to install idol on Sabarimala premises, TDB tells HC
content: Travancore Devaswom Board says it had not granted anyone the permission to collect money in this regard

title: Coconut oil prices singe household budgets in Kerala
content: A pricey Onam season on the cards as the price of a litre of coconut oil is expected to be between ₹500 and ₹600 during the festival season

title: Southern Railway to roll out Kavach on Ernakulam-Shoranur stretch
content: The project, which is expected to cost ₹105.8 crore, is to be completed in 18 months in the 106.8 km-long corridor

title: Bihar electoral roll revision: ECI says information on voters being shared with political parties
content: The move will help to re-verify names of those who have permanently shifted, are deceased or have enrolled at multiple places, says poll body

title: Defence Secretary lauds mountaineering expeditions to Mt. Everest and Mt. Kilimanjaro
content: Rajesh Kumar Singh praised the indomitable spirit of both teams, highlighting their mission not only about scaling the peaks but also to showcase India’s mountaineering excellence and leadership in adventure sports

title: Cabinet nod for constructing protective seawall on Pozhiyoor-Kollemcode stretch
content: This has been a long-pending demand of fisherfolk along the stretch since sea erosion and beach depletion have been endangering their lives and properties

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation achieves Water Plus status in Swachh Survekshan rankings
content: Corporation authorities say that the achievement is a result of the efforts taken to ensure scientific treatment of septage and sewerage waste. Eight municipalities in State have secured ranks in the top 100 cleanest cities in the country

title: 17 Municipal Corporations will be declared as plastic-free by next October, says CS
content: Awareness should be created about the harm posed by single-use plastic items, K. Vijayanand tells Collectors and calls upon the manufacturers to pay due attention to curb the menace

title: Kerala municipalities improve rankings in national cleanliness survey, eight in top 100
content: At the top of municipalities from the State was Kochi Corporation at rank 50 among all local bodies in the country.  The other municipalities from Kerala among the top 100 are Mattannur (rank 53), Thrissur Corporation (58), Kozhikode Corporation (70), Alappuzha municipality (80), Guruvayur municipality (82), Thiruvananthapuram Corporation (89) and Kollam

title: Shifting of Atmospheric Sciences dept. to main Cusat campus opposed
content: The strength of the programme lies in its natural and necessary integration with other Earth Science disciplines such as Physical Oceanography and Geology, which are housed on the Marine campus, say a section of the faculty, students, and alumni of the department

title: We don’t want confrontation with Telangana on river water sharing, says Naidu
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu calls for the two Telugu States to adopt ‘give and take’ policy to resolve issues; the water that starts from the footsteps of Mallanna will be taken to Venkanna, this is not just inter-linking of rivers but also Gods, he says after releasing water

title: PAC calls for Aadhaar review, flags high failure rate of biometric verification
content: Verification failures lead to wrongful exclusion of beneficiaries from welfare programmes, says Parliamentary panel headed by Congress leader; PAC also raises concerns about Aadhaar data leaks

title: Union Minister inaugurates Common Incubation Centre at IIT-Tirupati
content: Objective of the centre is to support and nurture entrepreneurial initiatives in Chittoor and Tirupati regions, and it will also cater to value addition and processing of the produce which is locally available in abundant quantities such as tomatoes and mangoes

title: A year later, Wayanad landslides survivors tell a tale of resilience
content: Heart-wrenching scenes await one at Puthumala in Meppadi village panchayat of Wayanad district, even one year after the massive landslide that took away 298 lives and all the earthly possessions of the villagers. Abdul Latheef Naha meets some of the survivors to bring home their stories of resilience and struggle to resume their lives, which were wrecked by the natural disaster last year

title: Bombay HC blocks US child’s adoption by Indian Muslim couple, cites JJ Act
content:
Rosy Sequeira is special correspondent at The TImes of India, Mumbai
since July 2011. She has covered Bombay High Court for over nine years
which includes her earlier stints with other newspapers. Her forte is
on-the-spot accurate reporting. She tries to bring a human face to the otherwise largely
drab court proceedings and constantly looks out for judicial observations 
that strike a chord with the common man.

title: Full list of every ESPYS 2025 Award winner
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One celebrates the greatest athletes and moments in sports . the show is underway on ABC and ESPN+ . find out who won here . click here for all the latest capital one news .

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Kendrick Perkins: Embiid feels pressured to play through injury showcases trust issues . he says he's leaning back on a couch that seemed spacious until he eased his long body onto it . his son, Arthur, peeks around corners from the hallway to see what we're up to .

title: Is fighting at home in New Orleans an advantage for Dustin Poirier at UFC 318?
content: Dustin Poirier chose Max Holloway to be his final opponent . he was a lightweight, his natural weight class, after cutting an extra 10 pounds to featherweight . poirier derived his most palpable jubilation that night from what he said to him immediately after the fight .

title: Fresh threads alert: NFL uniforms get an offseason glow up
content: the new "Charger Power" uniforms will be unveiled in the 2025 offseason . the new uniforms are a popular choice for the Chargers and the los Angeles chargers . they will return their jerseys and pants to their style before they changed their name .

title: How Gavin McKenna's Penn State commitment shifted the NHL prospect landscape
content: Gavin McKenna is a young offensive star for the NHL to market . he amassed 129 points in 56 games with the Medicine Hat Tigers last season . the 17-year-old phenom could have remained in the CHL for another year .

title: Evolution of WNBA All-Star Game uniforms
content: the 2025 WNBA All-Star Game reaches its 26-year milestone this weekend . caitlin Clark and Napheesa Collier are team captains after finishing as the top two fan vote-getters . each of them drafted their respective team on July 8 setting the stage for a matchup .
